books.title: Greene Ferne Farm
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: The inhabitants of the area around Greene Ferne Farm deal with harvest, social customs, family obligations, and romance in rural Victorian England.

books.title: The Laughing Cavalier
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: An ancestor of the Scarlet Pimpernel is recruited to kidnap a woman for a few days.

books.title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A collection of reminiscences and reflections from the author’s experiences.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Understood Betsy
books.author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher
books.summary: A young girl discovers independence, responsibility, and newfound confidence after being sent to live in a farmhouse with her extended family.

books.title: The School for Scandal
books.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
books.summary: Despite their best efforts, the rumormongers of 18th-century London are disappointed by their targets.

books.title: Electra
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A woman seeks revenge against her mother for the murder of her father.

books.title: The Chessmen of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Tara, Princess of Helium and daughter of John Carter, finds life-threatening adventure in thrilling far-off regions of Barsoom.

books.title: When God Laughs
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: The eleventh collection of short stories by Jack London.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.

books.title: The Valley of Fear
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The final novel in Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s Sherlock Holmes series follows the eponymous hero as he investigates a Sussex murder seemingly connected with a secret society.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: The Problems of Philosophy
books.author: Bertrand Russell
books.summary: A beginner’s guide to problems in various fields of philosophy.

books.title: North of Boston
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: A collection of Frost’s poetry.

books.title: The Devil’s Dictionary
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A witty, sharp collection of sardonic word definitions from the 1800s and early 1900s that provide a snapshot into the irreverent humor of early American culture.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Algis Budrys
books.summary: Science fiction short stories by author Algis Budrys.

books.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries.

books.title: Siddhartha
books.author: Hermann Hesse
books.summary: A man embarks on a spiritual journey through India.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
